sub_topic: Prove that the symmetric difference of two sets is not commutative with respect to Cartesian product.
message_1: Let A = {1, 2, 3} and B = {2, 3, 4}. Find the Cartesian product of (A Δ B) and (B Δ A) where Δ represents the symmetric difference of two sets. Show that the product is not commutative.
